name: wolffia
wildlife-value: Eaten by herbivorous fish and a variety of waterfowl.
edibility: The plant can be eaten as a vegetable. A high-protein food source, it contains approximately 40% protein.   In its native region, it is often eaten as a vegetable, having a taste similar to sweet cabbage.
light: Full sun (6 or more hours of direct sunlight a day)
fruit-description: Its fruit is a utricle, a small, bladder like, thin walled fruit.  Due to their tiny size, the fruits are not visible.
flower-description: Wolffia lays flat on the water surface resembling a green floating carpet.  The plant has a non-showy flower that does not bloom often.
